Title.En: Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI

Description.En:
**Module content**

This micro-module aims to introduce practical AI, focusing on basic machine learning. The goal is to understand how to build AI systems using machine learning, gain insight into the possibilities and limitations of the technology, and to get an overview of common methods for machine learning.

**Module outline**

Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI is an online module that you can take at your own pace. Simply go to the following website and start the course after you've been admitted: [https://buildingai.elementsofai.com/](https://buildingai.elementsofai.com/).

The micro-module is based on self-study and is examined with self-correcting tests and submissions. If you have completed the online module Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI with advanced honors, you can have your results validated. This includes a validation test with questions similar to those found in Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI. For more information see the module's info page: [Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI](https://www.ida.liu.se/~ETE337/info/courseinfo.en.shtml).

NoteLiteral.En: Describe what machine learning can be used for, as well as its possibilities and limitations.
Describe how data is used to train a machine learning model to solve a given problem.
Describe how optimisation is used to train machine learning models.
Describe the importance of handling uncertainty in machine learning and how probability theory can be used for this purpose.
Give an account of common methods and models used in machine learning.

Title.En: Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI
Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**The micro-module consists of five chapters:**

1. Getting started with AI
2. Dealing with uncertainty
3. Machine learning
4. Neural networks
5. Conclusions

Recommended self-study hours in total: 53 h

For more information, please check out the [syllabus for the micro-module](https://studieinfo.liu.se/en/kurs/ETE337/ht-2024#overview).
Learn about the practical methods that make artificial intelligence a reality

Building AI a flexible online module for anyone who wants to learn about 
how practical AI systems can be constructed using machine learning. You will get a solid introduction to machine learning and neural networks, and  will learn where and how AI methods are applied in real life. It is easy to move freely between the three difficulty levels, from multiple choice exercises to programming with Python – depending on whether you know programming or not.

**Flexible admission**

You can start the micro-module almost anytime you want as it is an online module with flexible admission.

**Entry requirements**

- Student must be admitted to studies at university level
- It is highly recommended to take the micro-module [Elements of AI](https://engage.eciu.eu/micro-modules/0fb06c9f-9f03-ef11-9f89-000d3a398ca7/elements-of-ai) before you take the Elements of AI, Part 2: Building AI

Applicants will be required to submit a transcript of records during the application process.

Applications will be continuously processed during the application period. Submitted applications will be assessed every Monday and the applicants will receive a results notification shortly after that. If admitted, the student will receive further instructions regarding the next steps in the process by the host university.
